Residential Pool Remodels Pool Renovation Pool Resurfacing & Replastering Pool Remarciting Pool Retiling Pool Equipment Installation Residential Pool Maintenance and Repairs Weekly Pool Cleaning Residential Pool Maintenance Pool Filter Cleaning Green to Clean Residential Pool Repairs Pool Inspections Pool Lighting Pool Fencing Commercial Pool Services Commercial Pool Maintenance Commercial Pool Remodels Commercial Pool Repairs Financing Selling Your Pool Route Outdoor Living Decking, Driveways, and Pavers Paver Options Pool Deck Drains Screen Enclosures Summer Kitchens Water Features, Firepits, Athletics and Other Galleries Residential Pool and Spa Build Residential Pool Remodel Commercial Pool Remodel Pool Plaster Options Outdoor Living Maintenance and Repair FAQs About Our Story Meet the Team Blog Referral Program News Pool Construction Customer Reviews Locations Serviced CAREERS Contact Us Custom Swimming Pools at Jacksonville Country Club A Prestigious Neighborhood North Florida's Jacksonville Golf & Country Club features a gracious low country-style clubhouse nestled on gently rolling terrain. Along the Northeast Coast of Florida, this idyllic setting is surrounded by abundant tree cover, tranquil freshwater lakes, and thriving wildlife. Jacksonville Golf & Country Club was founded in June 1987 with the acquisition of 732 acres for $10.4 million, naming the area "Jacksonville Country Club." The groundbreaking ceremony for the Club's 18-hole golf course, designed by golf course architect Clyde Johnston with player consultant Fuzzy Zoeller, took place in the Spring of 1988. Hunt Club Road's brick entryway was completed in June 1989, setting a prestigious tone for the neighborhood. In 1989, Jacksonville Golf & Country Club welcomed its first residents as a private, member-owned club. Exquisite Pools Built in Jacksonville Country Club Take a moment to imagine yourself in your new pool, floating lazily or doing laps in your exercise pool. When you’re finished, you can climb up to your outdoor kitchen, make a drink, and even cook breakfast. You can also lie on your tanning ledge and catch some healing rays. A firepit can be lit after the sun goes down, and you can entertain friends and family with food from your BBQ or firepit. Coastal Luxury Outdoors can help you realize your vision. We have been providing leading swimming pool services to Florida residents for many years. With this experience, we have gained a thorough understanding of the latest design trends that ensure your custom pool looks stylish and contemporary. Contact Us New Pool Construction and Existing Pool Remodeling New Residential Pool Building a new pool offers homeowners the unique opportunity to customize their outdoor living space from the ground up, tailoring every aspect of the pool's design, size, and features to match their vision and lifestyle. This process involves selecting from a variety of pool types, materials, and innovative technologies to create a personalized oasis that complements the home's architecture and the natural landscape. Here at Coastal Luxury Outdoors we offer free 3D design consultations to help you transform your vision into reality. Residential Pool Remodels Remodeling an existing pool allows homeowners to breathe new life into their current setup. Whether it's updating the pool's aesthetics with modern finishes and materials, enhancing functionality with the latest energy-efficient equipment, or adding luxurious features like waterfalls, spas, or automated cleaning systems, remodeling can transform an outdated pool into a modern retreat. Both building a new pool and remodeling an existing one require careful planning, design expertise, and a commitment to quality craftsmanship. However, each route provides a pathway to achieving a dream outdoor space that increases property value, encourages outdoor living, and creates a haven for relaxation and entertainment. Check out our full gallery featuring new pool creations and before and after images of remodeled pools . Top Trending Outdoor Features Our Clients Love in Jax Country Club Our elite pools are the best of the best, built to the specifications of our customers, no matter how complex those might be. From tropical resort like pools complete with caves, slides, waterfalls, and fountains. Include a bridge or an infinity spa. With so much to choose from our gallery options must be seen to be believed. Your pool will be planned, designed, and built by experts. Landscape architects and structural engineers combine to bring your dream to life – whatever you’ve envisioned for your backyard, we know exactly how to make it happen. There’s no pool too complex, and no project too ambitious. Coastal Luxury Outdoors has been building incredible pools in Florida for over 40 years, making thousands of dreams come true. If you’d like to be next, contact us today! How To Get Started? The best way to fully transform your outdoor space is through our custom outdoor living design and installation. We love adding thoughtful touches and unique features that will make your backyard both beautiful and functional. These outdoor living design services will make your home the place for entertaining, relaxing, and spending time with friends and family. Start the process and contact us . We'll require a property survey stamped by a licensed surveyor Review your 3D design You’ll review a state-of-the-art 3D presentation of the design We'll provide a quote and a detailed proposal. Our estimates will be the most detailed proposals you will find! Let the building start! Once we have a signed contract, we'll begin the construction process About Coastal Luxury Outdoors Coastal Luxury Outdoors is your premier local swimming pool contractor with decades of experience across Florida and Georgia. Our expertise and experience will ensure that you can build and enjoy the pool you've always wanted. Remodeling and renovating pools is what we do best. Our local experts at Coastal Luxury Outdoors can transform your pool into your ideal outdoor living space, from tile and coping to replastering and decking. And our maintenance services are second to none! Get in touch with us today to schedule a consultation! We offer a full spectrum of pool services across the following locations and more: Queens Harbor , Rivertown , Fernandina , Mandarin , Palencia , Plantation Oaks , Orange Park , Seven Pines , Bay Meadows , Sawgrass , Nocatee , E-Town , Coastal Grove , Neptune Beach , Julington Creek , and Tamaya . Where Vision and Possibility Meet Call Now Home About Pool Services Outdoor Living Galleries Selling Your Pool Route Blog Contact Us Contact Us: 904-543-2626 | service@coastalluxurypv.com We at Coastal Luxury Outdoors are leaders in pool construction, repair & maintenance in Jacksonville & St. Augustine, FL. Schedule an inspection & estimate today! Click through for contact information for every member of our team including sales, destination experience, marketing, media, and more. Executive Team Michael Corrigan President & CEO Charged with marketing, selling and promoting Jacksonville’s image, driving visitation and boosting the economy through tourism. Office Phone: (904) 421-9150 Send An Email Sarina Wiechens Chief Operating Officer Oversees the daily operations and financial components of Visit Jacksonville to implement the vision and mission of the organization and CEO/President. Office Phone: (904) 421-9152 Send An Email Katie Mitura Chief Marketing Officer Oversees the Marketing team to implement the goals of the President and CEO for Visit Jacksonville pertaining to marketing Jacksonville as a premier destination. Office Phone: (904) 421-9160 Send An Email Jeanne Goldschmidt Director of Convention Sales Oversees the Convention Sales team to implement the goals of the President and CEO of Visit Jacksonville pertaining to growth of bookings and support within the destination. Office Phone: (904) 421-9164 Send An Email Courtney Gumbinger Director of Destination Experience Oversees the Destination Experience team to implement the goals of the President and CEO to provide exceptional customer service to both individual visitors as well as group and meeting attendees. Office Phone: (904) 421-9151 Send An Email Administration Becky Bulmer Assistant Director of Finance Responsible for the financial oversight and integrity of financial processes for the organization. Oversees all accounting functions. Office Phone: (904) 421-9189 Send An Email Eva Soto Accounting Manager Responsible for financial oversight, payment processing, financial statements and all financial aspects of the business. Office Phone: (904) 421-9155 Send An Email Laurie Degon Senior Analytics Manager Responsible for data analytics and reporting to develop marketplace analysis of trends in tourism as well as economic impact forecasts. Office Phone: (904) 421-9178 Send An Email Lisa Sharrit Administration Manager Responsible for human resources and insurance components for Visit Jacksonville. Liaison to the Board of Directors. Office Phone: (904) 421-9181 Send An Email Convention Sales Bob Doering Senior National Accounts Manager Responsible for promoting Jacksonville as a premier destination for Corporate, State and National Association conferences and events. Office Phone: (904) 798-9123 Send An Email Emma Carlo National Accounts Manager Responsible for promoting Jacksonville as a premier destination to the Social, Military, Religious and Fraternal markets. Office Phone: (904) 421-9172 Send An Email Sydney Lindblad Sales Development Manager Responsible for promoting Jacksonville as a premier destination to meetings of less than 200 total room nights and sporting events of all sizes. Office Phone: (904) 421-9182 Send An Email Gaby Mikaiel Sales and Administration Manager Responsible for administrative support, grant process management and travel coordination for the sales team and President. Office Phone: (904) 421-9159 Send An Email Destination Experience Paloma Martin Senior Destination Experience Manager Responsible for providing exceptional customer service, referrals, trip planning services and amenities in our visitor centers as well as to groups and planners, and acts as liaison with local hoteliers and businesses. Office Phone: (904) 421-9176 Send An Email Jorie Allinson Destination Experience Manager Responsible for providing exceptional customer service, referrals, trip planning services and amenities in our visitor centers as well as to groups and planners and oversees visitor center staffing. Office Phone: (904) 421-9154 Send An Email Kerry Weatherhead Destination Experience Coordinator Responsible for assisting visitors contacting or entering centers or as a part of a conference or group with requests for information, maps and brochures, referrals and trip planning services. Office Phone: (904) 798-9111 Send An Email Seymour Jax Responsible for showing you all there is to do and see in Jacksonville. Seymour often roams the streets and is set up at special events. Stop by, say hi, take a selfie… Meet Seymour Marketing Andrea Mestdagh Senior Marketing Communications Manager Responsible for marketing, communication and public relations initiatives to promote and market Jacksonville as a premier leisure destination to key markets. Office Phone: (904) 421-9169 Send An Email Tess Chalifour-Drahman Meetings Marketing Manager Responsible for marketing initiatives and strategies to entice conventions and groups to book their meetings in Jacksonville. Office Phone: (904) 421-9162 Send An Email Joey Bell Community Outreach Manager Responsible for managing outreach initiatives and growing relationships in the local community with all tourism partners and business entities. Office Phone: (904) 421-9157 Send An Email Autumn Leach Marketing Communications Manager Responsible for Visit Jacksonville’s website, promotions and other major marketing initiatives. Office Phone: (904) 421-9166 Send An Email Lauren Hickox Marketing Manager Responsible for assisting with the research and development of marketing materials, website content, app content, email content, and various marketing initiatives. Office Phone: (904) 421-9183 Send An Email Tucker Responsible for exploring Jacksonville and posing for photos. Follow his adventures on Instagram! Meet Tucker Want to join our team? After 97 years, Garden Club hires first executive director News Sports Entertainment Lifestyle Opinion Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals HOME-GARDEN After 97 years, Garden Club hires first executive director Beth Reese Cravey beth.cravey@jacksonville.com The Garden Club of Jacksonville has been led by its own members since founder Ninah Cummer and 20 friends organized in 1922 to help beautify the community. Almost 100 years later, the club has grown to at least 800 members and recently hired its first executive director — communications and nonprofit veteran Denise Reagan — and expanded its goals beyond beautification. Reagan and the governing board will have an open house Sept. 10 to discuss the club's future with the public. "We will use our collective voice to champion green spaces, encourage effective tree planting, build access to fresh fruits and vegetables, protect the health of the St. Johns River and promote sustainability," Reagan said. "These are some of the goals that emerged from the strategic planning process. Our members enjoy getting their hands dirty on community projects like these." The club's expanded view stems from a "thorough strategic planning process" last fall that was funded by a grant from the Jessie Ball duPont Fund, she said. The club has offered educational programs, demonstrations and youth classes but is adding more evening and weekend events to be "more inclusive and accessible to working parents and young professionals," Reagan said. A new membership program also will be introduced that will provide discounts to club events and other perks. "We want to collaborate with partners that share our mission and find those who want to join us as we donate our time and talent to build a better and more beautiful city," she said. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. Club President Bobi McGinnis said Reagan's background made her the board's choice to lead the organization into the future. "Denise embodies all the qualities we were looking for in an executive director," she said. "She has developed lifelong relationships throughout the Jacksonville community and across the country that will help the Garden Club reach a more diverse audience." A Jacksonville native, Reagan worked at newspapers and websites in six cities before returning home 13 years ago to be an editor at The Florida Times-Union. She later served as editor of Folio Weekly, communications director at the Museum of Contemporary Art Jacksonville and senior manager of public relations at Brunet García Advertising. She was also an adjunct professor at the University of Florida College of Journalism and Communications, her alma mater. Reagan shares the club's love of gardening and green space. She and her daughter planted a backyard garden with dozens of vegetables, fruits and herbs and she visits gardens and parks in the Jacksonville area and while traveling. "I have a first-hand appreciation of how green spaces can build community and sustain the environment," she said. "This knowledge fuels my desire to expand Jacksonville’s green spaces and increase access to fresh fruits and vegetables through community gardens. These projects can change lives. "Green spaces help give a city its identity," she said. "The Garden Club wants to underscore just how important these spaces are to the health and well-being of Jacksonville and the impact we all have on the natural world." The initial group founded by Cummer, a local civic leader and philanthropist, proved so popular that subgroups, called garden circles, were established throughout Jacksonville. Now there are 31 circles, each with 15 to 55 members, who meet monthly from October to May at the club's Riverside headquarters or in their neighborhoods. Members do not have to live in Jacksonville. "The circles emphasize different areas of interest and meet in different regions of the city. The Garden Club is the umbrella organization for all of those circles and the new membership levels we are offering," Reagan said. "The … club welcomes anyone who has a love of gardening, the environment and natural world." Early on the club focused on civic projects, city planning and the creation and revitalization of city parks. Members helped preserve many of the city’s ancient live oak trees, replaced many sycamore trees with live oaks and, along with philanthropist Jessie Ball duPont, rescued the historic Treaty Oak, according to the club website. Members raised money to buy land on the St. Johns River and construct their original clubhouse, which was destroyed by fire, according to the club website. In 1948, the Club Room was built, including a large fireplace, a brass chandelier and a small kitchen and in 1958 the grand ballroom was constructed, featuring floor-to-ceiling windows, six crystal chandeliers and a stage. The campus, located on Riverside Avenue near the Cummer Museum, also includes a courtyard, huge catering kitchens, offices and storage space and is available for rent for corporate retreats, business lunches, weddings and other events. Beth Reese Cravey: (904) 359-4109 Executive Director Denise Reagan and The Garden Club of Jacksonville's governing board will have an open house 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. Sept. 10 to discuss the nonprofit’s future. The club is at 1005 Riverside Ave., Jacksonville, FL 32204. Fore information call (904) 355-4224, email info@gardenclubofjacksonville.org or go to gardenclubofjacksonville.org . Who We Are | Queen's Harbour Yacht & Country Club | Jacksonville, FL | Invited × Thank you for visiting our site. Please review our Privacy Policy . We use cookies on our site and collect other information pursuant to our Privacy Policy. By continuing to use our site, you consent to our Privacy Policy and data collection practices. OK Skip to Content Opens in new tab Member Login Benefits Finder Opens in new tab Careers Queen's Harbour Yacht & Country Club Main Site Navigation Who We Are Golf Dining Membership Tournaments & Events Join Now Book A Tee Time Login - Opens in new tab Menu Who We Are Our Team Calendar Directions & Hours Golf Golf Course Dining Membership Tournaments & Events Weddings Meetings & Corporate Events Tournaments & Outings Event Rooms Contact Us Opens in new tab Member Login Benefits Finder Opens in new tab Careers Home Who We Are Our Team Calendar Directions & Hours Enjoy Your Best Life at Queen's Harbour Welcome and thank you for your interest in our Club. Join us and enjoy the many benefits and privileges of club life, as well as the lifelong friendships and fond memories you'll create here. No distractions, no interruptions, just quality family time, business networking and resort-style living – right in your backyard. Schedule A Tour Enjoy The Best Of All Worlds Queen's Harbour provides its Members with the best of all worlds including the surrounding freshwater yacht basin and Intracoastal waterway. The beautiful low country clubhouse, with its portico and sweeping verandas, combines Florida elegance with casual informality. Attractively positioned to overlook the lush natural surroundings and the 76-slip marina, the charming Harbour View Dining Room, The King's Tavern and The Queen's Parlor and Compass Board Room accommodate the business and social needs of our Members. Club amenities include lighted tennis courts, swimming pool, clubhouse dining, complimentary use of our private meeting and dining rooms with full-service catering and event planning and exclusive social and fun-filled family events. Recognized for Environmental Excellence Queen’s Harbour has retained its designation as a "Certified Audubon Cooperative Sanctuary" through the Audubon Cooperative Sanctuary Program for Golf Courses, an Audubon International program. Our golf was designated as a Certified Audubon Cooperative Sanctuary in 2002 and is one of over 900 courses in the world to hold certification from Audubon International. The Audubon Cooperative Sanctuary Program for Golf Courses, endorsed by the United States Golf Association, provides information and guidance to help golf courses preserve and enhance wildlife habitat and protect natural resources. Club Events Whether you’re part of an active family or you’re a busy professional with a passion for sports and social activities, we provide facilities and features to meet all your needs. With exceptional programming, business and social events, Members build lifelong relationships and develop a network of connections that lead to personal fulfillment and invaluable family memories. Tournaments Join your fellow Members for fun and competitive Club-hosted tournaments. This is Club spirit at its finest. Networking Build your network of business and social connections at our special Member events. Our Members include local professionals, civic and community leaders and other influential people to enhance your circle of friends. Kids & Family We offer programs for kids of all ages and their families. From sports teams and leagues to special dining events and fun activities, we have something for every member of your family. Enriching Programs Our programs are designed to enrich your life with cultural, educational and business-oriented events to match your interests. Enjoy guest speakers, professional seminars and special Member clubs and events. Holidays We enjoy celebrating holidays at the Club. Watch our calendar for special traditions and events, as well as holiday dining features. We’re also ready to help you host the perfect party with catering for any occasion. DB Donald  Beardsley General Manager Contact Me Contact Me About Donald + Close Donald  Beardsley information modal DB Donald  Beardsley General Manager Serving since 2020 Donald .Beardsley Donald .Beardsley Contact Me About Donald Don has been GM for 4 years and enjoys leading the team at Queen's Harbour Yacht & Country Club.After attending LaSalle University, he began his golf management career working for Invited in the Philadelphia market. After Invited sold the Philadelphia contracts, he managed golf facilities in Pennsylvania, Florida and Alabama, then returning to Pennsylvania. Along this journey, he learned from and met some of the greatest mentors and members. Being a PGA member for over 25 years, he has been fortunate to be nominated as a golf professional of the year and resort merchandiser of the year. He was instrumental in starting a junior golf program for inner-city youths in York, Pennsylvania, called York Youth Links, which still exists today.Utilizing hands-on leadership, Don has had great success in his management career, and he looks forward to using his experience and knowledge to make the member experience the best it can be.
